alert.note: Alert for Tippecanoe (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 11:46AM EST until February 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. Wabash River at Lafayette. .Rain, heavy at times, is expected to move into the region tonight and continue through Thursday. Total rainfall amounts of over two inches are expected. This rainfall in addition to snow melt is expected to lead to moderate flooding near Lafayette along the Wabash River and Wildcat Creek. Another system early next week could lengthen the amount of time in flood and produce additional rises on both rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding of Wildcat Creek Park and possible residential areas in the vicinity of Eisenhower Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 4.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 15.0 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued by late this evening.
